comment: Dirac bra-ket associative law ` ( | A >. ` ` <. B | ) | C >. = ` ` | A >. ( <. B | C >. ) ` i.e. the juxtaposition of an outer product with a ket equals a bra juxtaposed with an inner product. Since ` <. B | C >. ` is a complex number, it is the first argument in the inner product ` .h ` that it is mapped to, although in Dirac notation it is placed after the ket. (Contributed by NM, 15-May-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
